No. 113
United States Commercial Agency
Ack. Nov.10. 76.
Loanda 29th. August 1876
div1.p: Mr. Robert Scott Newton To the Department of State
Subject.__Abolition of domestic slavery in Angola.
Abstract of contents. Domestic Slavery abolished in the Portuguese West African Colonies, on the 17th July by Royal Decree of 29th April. Probable effects of the Emancipation.

div1.opener:
No 113. United States Commercial Agency
Loanda 29th August 1876
The Assistant Secretary of State Washington D.C.
div1.p:
Sir,
I have the honor to report to the Department that Domestic Slavery ceased to be recognized by the Portuguese Government, throughout all their possessions on the West Coast of Africa, on the 17th July, according to the Royal Decree of the 29th, April.

As I expected no demonstration of any kind whatever took place in Loanda; either on the part of the Government, the European residents, or the liberated slaves themselves, not
not a flag was displayed, nor a gun fired, to mark the importance of a day which gave liberty to thousands. This can be explained only by the slaves themselves doubting the reality of their new state, and the want of interest taken in the movement by both Government and residents. Outwardly the day passed off in the usual way, nor has there since been any apparent difference in the city. The slaves who liked their masters have, with few exceptions, remained, receiving the price of their services, which has been determined by Goverment. An office has been estabished in Loanda, where all contracts made between the planters and the freedmen
freedmen are registered, according to the rate of wages fixed by law, and where they can complain, in case that their contracts are not fully carried out. In contracting with the freedmen; their late owners have, according to law, the preference to their services for a term of two years they paying them, according to the established rate, viz;--
Men and women per month 3 $00 =$3.36 Youths 15 to 21 years " " 2 $ 500 = $2.77 dos. 11 to 15 " " " 1 $ 950 = $2.12

If preferred, the contract can be made for food and clothing, and a smaller amount per month. By this plan planters are enabled to retain the services of their best
best hands, and are thus saved from considerable loss and inconvenience. Large numbers of the liberated slaves from the plantations in the neighbourhood, at first left their employmement, and came to the city, but when they found that liberty did not mean idleness, and that they were obliged to work for the Government until they arranged other employment, they have nearby all returned.

From the interior I have no definite news of the results of the emancipation, but I expect that it will make little change there. I hear complaints of the great scarcity of labour in proportion to
to the increase of the plantations; but there has been no outbreak nor is there any anticipated. It will no doubt take some time before both planters and natives get accustomed to the new state of things. Previously a planter could always purchase laborers, now he has to go into the open hiring market, where he meets with considerable competition in consequence of a number of small planters having recently sprung up, who can now procure labour, without a large outlay of capital in the purchase of Slaves.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be,
Your most obedient servant,
closer.signed:
Robt S Newton
Vice Commercial Agent
